intro: Amaryllis tucumana, commonly known as the Tucumán amaryllis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Uruguay. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant produces large, strap-like leaves that are evergreen and can grow up to 1 meter in height. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and indoor cultivation.
